article.headline: Longwood 68, Savannah St. 64
article.story: SAVANNAH, Ga. -- Dana Smith scored 18 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to help Longwood beat Savannah State 68-64 on Saturday. Kevin Swecker also had 18 points for the Lancers (13-10), who have won six games in a row. Longwood trailed 29-27 at halftime and went down by four points to start the second half on a jumper by Savannah State's Raye Bailey. But the Lancers never trailed again, as Longwood shot 48.3 percent from the floor (23-for-52) compared to the Tigers' 38.5 percent (20-for-54) in the second half. Longwood outscored Savannah State 13-6 for more than three minutes to claim a 64-58 lead on Durann Neil's jumper with 4:53 left. Anthony Jones scored on layup with 26 seconds left for Savannah State (12-12) to cut the lead to 66-64, but Smith followed with two free throws to put the game away for Longwood. Chris Linton led the Tigers with 14 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
